body:
<!-- This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to Bitcoin Core.

I have a bitcoin Node set up and it has synced to the lastet block but when ever i do the node-upgrade it synchronizes the blockheaders again from start. Is there any way we can avoid as i already have the block downloaded.Please find the logs and docker-compose file.

Logs :
2021-05-26T07:17:22Z Synchronizing blockheaders, height: 229998 (~34.96%)
2021-05-26T07:17:23Z Synchronizing blockheaders, height: 231998 (~35.25%)

docker-compose.yaml:

version: '2'
services:
    node:
        image: kylemanna/bitcoind:latest
        container_name: bitcoind_container
        restart: always
        ports:
            - "8333:8333"
            - "8334:8332"
        environment:
            PRINTTOCONSOLE: 1
            RPCUSER: "xxx"
            RPCPASSWORD: "xxx"
        volumes:
            - $PWD:/bitcoin
        command:
            - "-onlynet=ipv4"
            - "-txindex"
            - "-rpcthreads=128"
            - "-dbcache=1024"
            - "-rpcallowip=0.0.0.0/0"
            - "-rpcbind=127.0.0.1"
            - "-rpcbind=bitcoind_container"
            - "-blocksonly=1"
        mem_limit: 4g
title: Bitcoin Node Synchronizing BlockHeaders
